channel.title: Wellcome to my website
channel.description: Recent content on Wellcome to my website

item.title: Personal Website using R and Github

item.description: About me I am a Ph.D. student of Computer Science at Iowa State University of Science and Technology under supervision of Dr. Robyn Lutz in the Laboratory for Software Safety (LSS) . Educational Background I have earned my M. S. degree in Software Engineering from Shiraz University in 2012 and my bachelor in Computer Engineering (Software) from Shahid Chamran University of Ahvaz (former Jondishapur). Certifications Eighth Summer School on Formal Techniques, May 19 - May 25, 2018, Menlo College, Atherton, CA

I keep record of books that I read and movies that I watched. Books Sophie’s World: A Novel About the History of Philosophy FALL IS THE LAST SEASON OF THE YEAR by Nasim Marashi Movies Bohemian Rhapsody (2018) Mary Queen of Scots (2018) Series True Detective (2019) The Handmaid’s Tale(2018)

Research Interests My research interests include the principles and applications of Software Engineering, Software Safety, Software Product Line, and Machine Learning. I’m currently focusing on effective and efficient methods to detect and predict Feature Interaction in Software Product line. Publications S. Khoshmanesh and R. R. Lutz, “The Role of Similarity in Detecting Feature Interaction in Software Product Lines,” 2018 IEEE International Symposium on Software Reliability Engineering Workshops (ISSREW), Memphis, TN, USA, 2018, pp.
